channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump's planned troop pullout from Germany has many military holes
Trump files emergency request to prevent subpoena of his tax records after judge denies motion
item.description: Lawyers for President Donald Trump filed an emergency request Friday for a federal appeals court to put a subpoena for his financial documents and tax returns on hold until the higher court can weigh in on the matter.

item.title: GOP strategist gets emotional over DNC moment
item.description: CNN Republican strategist Scott Jennings says the highlight of the fourth night of the DNC was the story of a 13-year-old boy overcoming the insecurity of his stutter.

item.title: Flight carrying comatose Russian dissident Navalny lands in Berlin
item.description: A medical evacuation flight carrying Alexey Navalny has left Omsk and is on its way to Germany, after the Russian opposition leader fell gravely ill in a suspected poisoning.

item.title: Spat at, segregated, policed: Hong Kong's dark-skinned minorities say they've never felt accepted
Germany reports highest daily spike in coronavirus cases since late April
Mexico's solution to the Covid-19 educational crisis: Put school on television
item.description: The JimÃ©nez family have their morning routine down to a science. Or at least, they used to.

item.title: These men received 505-year prison sentences each. Now their cases are under new scrutiny
item.description: On an August afternoon in 1991, a federal judge in California sent an unmistakable message in the "war on drugs" when he sentenced four men convicted of laundering cocaine cartel cash to more than 500 years each in prison.

item.title: Court orders Donald Trump to pay legal fees in Stormy Daniels suit
item.description: A California Superior Court judge has ordered President Donald Trump to pay $44,100 to Stephanie Clifford, also known as Stormy Daniels, to reimburse her attorneys' fees in the legal battle surrounding her nondisclosure agreement.

item.title: Golden State Killer, who confessed to 13 murders and dozens of rapes, sentenced to life in prison
item.description: A former California police officer who became known as the notorious Golden State Killer said he was "truly sorry" before he was sentenced to life without the possibility of parole on Friday.

item.title: Berman to Pence: How can you not know about QAnon?
item.description: CNN's John Berman presses Vice President Mike Pence on the QAnon conspiracy theory after President Donald Trump seemed to embrace the fringe group.

item.title: US intel agencies find Wuhan officials kept Beijing in the dark for weeks about coronavirus
item.description: US intelligence has gathered information showing that officials in Wuhan, China, kept senior officials in Beijing in the dark for weeks about the virus that resulted in the Covid-19 pandemic, according to US officials familiar with the intelligence.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Lori Loughlin and husband to serve prison time in college admissions scandal
item.description: Lori Loughlin, the famed actress who became the face of the college admissions scandal, is expected to be sentenced to prison on Friday, a fate she and her husband, Mossimo Giannulli, fought to avoid from the moment they were charged by federal authorities.

item.title: Joe Biden takes on Trump-era traumas in career-defining speech
What Kamala Harris' Indian roots reveal about the US
item.description: When Shyamala Gopalan first came to the United States, there were only around 12,000 Indian immigrants living here.

item.title: Justice Department says former Green Beret allegedly provided secrets to Russia
item.description: A former Army Green Beret has been charged with providing information about US national defenses to Russian agents, the Department of Justice announced on Friday.

item.title: Meghan on voting in 2020: If you aren't voting, 'then you're complicit'
item.description: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, spoke on the importance of voting during an event with Michelle Obama's voter registration organization Thursday, saying that if you don't vote, "then you're complicit."

item.title: The US Postal Service controversy, explained
Ardern wants to eliminate coronavirus. Is she setting herself up to fail?
CDC updates school guidelines for Covid-19 pandemic
item.description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention updated its school guidance Friday. The update adds more details to existing guidelines that will better inform administrators' decisions about opening schools and limit risk, according to CDC Director Dr. Robert Redfield.

item.title: Giant panda gives birth at the National Zoo
item.description: The Smithsonian National Zoo has grown by four paws with the birth of a giant panda cub.

item.title: California wildfires kill at least 4 people as some evacuees weigh coronavirus risks at shelters
Iowa tries to recover from extensive damage caused by a 14-hour 'land hurricane'
item.description: Every Wednesday night, Danielle Hecker is part of a bike club that rides the streets of Cedar Rapids, Iowa. But lately, the group of about 20 people isn't out leisurely enjoying late summer evenings.

item.title: Lifelong Republican and NRA member says he will vote for Biden
item.description: Edward Good, a 95-year-old war veteran and lifelong Republican denounced Donald Trump in his speech during the Democratic National Convention and called on the country to vote for Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden.

item.title: Four crew members missing after ship hits propane pipeline in Texas
item.description: The US Coast Guard is searching for four people after a dredging vessel hit a propane pipeline Friday morning in the Port of Corpus Christi Ship Channel in Texas, officials said.

item.title: Purdue University students suspended after attending off-campus party
item.description: Three dozen Purdue University students were suspended this week for attending an off-campus party, violating the school's social distancing rules.

item.title: Brawl erupts on airplane over masks
item.description: Airline passengers brawl over seats and masks. CNN's Jeanne Moos has the blow-by-blow account.

item.title: Grand Canyon cliff collapse reveals 313 million-year-old fossil footprints
item.description: Finding fossil footprints at the Grand Canyon isn't particularly unusual. The expansive stretch of red rock is home to an array of formations containing preserved remains of the past.

item.title: Hear from couple who lost only child in the Beirut blast
item.description: A young couple lost their only child, three-year-old Alexandra, in the Beirut blast. Like so many Lebanese who survived the explosion but lost so much, the couple tells CNN's Ben Wedeman they are close to giving up on a country that is falling apart.

item.title: Teens are having unprotected sex, driving drunk and vaping among other risky behaviors, CDC says
Defying Bolsonaro, Brazilian congress orders mandatory mask wearing
item.description: Brazil's congress voted for mandatory mask wearing in closed spaces such as commercial establishments, offices, schools and places of worship, overturning President Jair Bolsonaro's previous veto. CNN's Rafael Romo reports.

item.title: How one hotel helped unleash Australia's new outbreak
item.description: More than 90% of new Covid-19 cases in Australia's state of Victoria can be traced back to one quarantine hotel, officials say. The state has launched a judicial inquiry into what went wrong in the quarantine hotels that helped unleash a fresh outbreak in the state. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

item.title: The 'next Usain Bolt' won't put a limit on what he can achieve
item.description: He may be in the early stages of his pole vault career, but Armand "Mondo" Duplantis has already scaled the summit of his sport.

item.title: Songbirds sing so loudly at dawn because they're warming up, study finds
item.description: Songbirds, they're just like us.

item.title: The New York Mets have 4 games postponed as players quarantine in New York and Miami
item.description: Members of the New York Mets are quarantining in two different cities after the team reported two Covid-19 cases this week.

item.title: Sevilla continues Europa League love affair with final victory over Inter Milan
item.description: Sevilla's love affair with the Europa League continues as the Spanish club beat Inter Milan 3-2 Friday in a thrilling final to win a record-extending sixth title and its fourth in the last seven years.

item.title: Scientists have 'digitally unwrapped' some Egyptian animal mummies, including a kitten and cobra
item.description: Researchers at a UK university have "digitally unwrapped" three mummified animals from ancient Egypt using high-resolution 3D scans.

item.title: Spectacular new step-bridge 'floats' over Norwegian waterfall
item.description: Rushing water cascades below an elevated footbridge that looks like it's floating on air, with panoramic views of hazy mountains and a plunging, deep valley underneath.

item.title: How a 500-year-old Chinese 'bagel' helped win a war
item.description: This round bread might look like a bagel. It's even got the trademark hole in the middle. But this is not a bagel. It's guang-bing, and it's got a heroic past. This is the story of how a humble little doughy treat helped China win a war 500 years ago. And that hole? There's a story there, too.

item.title: Europe's travel windows are slamming shut
item.description: The vacation lights are going out all over Europe.

item.title: How this all-Muslim girls basketball team is crushing it on the court
item.description: Hear that swish? That's the Salam Stars crushing it on the court. The all-female varsity basketball team is made up of Muslim students from the Salam School, an Islamic school in Milwaukee. All the players wear hijabs and modest athletic wear. In an ideal world, that wouldn't be a big deal, but they often face judgment based on their outfits and their religion. But these athletes ignore the haters. The Salam Stars are focused on the game. They play to win while making space for other girls to do the same.

item.title: Why the world's best mathematicians are hoarding chalk
item.description: Hagoromo is more than just a chalk; the Japanese brand that glides effortlessly across the blackboard has become legendary in the mathematics field.

item.title: The withdrawal of almost 12,000 troops could cost billions of dollars and provide few benefits, experts tell CNN
Hong Kong's dark-skinned minorities: We're segregated, spat at, policed
What Steve Bannon bust reveals about 'building the wall'
item.description: The arrest of Trump's ex-campaign chief and former White House advisor Steve Bannon, and three others, on federal charges that they defrauded those who donated to a nonprofit called -- wait for it -- We Build The Wall -- has added one more big name to the list of Trump-adjacent figures who have found trouble with the law.

item.title: Ex-Trump official: Fox host was Trump's shadow chief of staff
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper talks with Miles Taylor, a former Department of Homeland Security official in the Trump administration, about why he called Fox host Lou Dobbs Trump's "shadow chief of staff."

item.title: Satellite photos appear to show Chinese submarine using underground base
Biden's campaign says it raised $70 million
item.description: â¢ Analysis: Biden makes GOP attack line seem like a miscalculation â¢ Pence: I've got a news flash for Joe Biden â¢ Opinion: How Biden complicated Trump's life
